catalog_info.title: Beyond Dualism: Descartes on Human Nature (Proseminar)
catalog_info.description: Descartes is often associated with mind-body dualism, skepticism about the senses, and intellectual rationalism.  We’ll explore a less familiar side of Descartes:  his account of human nature centers on the union of mind and body and casts the senses and passions as critical guides to human life and action.  We will then explore the views of some important period critics of Cartesian dualism, including Princess Elizabeth of Bohemia, Margaret Cavendish, Anne Conway, and Mary Astell.
